titleStmt.title: The orator handling a hundred seuerall discourses, in forme of declamations: some of the arguments being drawne from Titus Liuius and other ancient vvriters, the rest of the authors owne inuention: part of which are of matters happened in our age. Written in French by Alexander Siluayn, and Englished by L.P.
Epitomes des cent histoires tragicques. English
titleStmt.author: Le Sylvain, ca. 1535-ca. 1585.
Pyott, Lazarus.
Munday, Anthony, 1553-1633, attributed name.

notesStmt.note: The translation sometimes attributed to Anthony Munday.
A translation of: Epitomes des cent histoires tragicques.
Caption title reads: The mirrour of eloquence.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
